definition: an indication of damage, cause friction
details:
noun
- an indication of damage
= synonyms: mark
- (golf) a handicap of zero strokes
= example: (golf) a handicap of zero strokes
- poor handwriting
= synonyms: scribble
- a harsh noise made by scraping
= synonyms: scraping, scratching, scrape
- dry mash for poultry
= synonyms: chicken feed
- a line indicating the location of the start of a race or a game
= synonyms: start
- a competitor who has withdrawn from competition
- informal terms for money
= synonyms: boodle
- a depression scratched or carved into a surface
= synonyms: incision
- an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off
= synonyms: scrape, excoriation, abrasion
verb
- cause friction
= example: cause friction
= synonyms: rub
- cut the surface of
= synonyms: scrape, scratch up
- carve, cut, or etch into a material or surface
= synonyms: grave
- gather (money or other resources) together over time
= synonyms: scrape, come up, scrape up
- remove by erasing or crossing out or as if by drawing a line
= synonyms: strike
- scrape or rub as if to relieve itching
= example: scrape or rub as if to relieve itching
= synonyms: rub
- postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled
= synonyms: scrub
